description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans), seeking to eliminate the need for a Rotating Parking Platform, in pursuant to planning permission reference  200760FUL dated 12/02/2021 for 'Construction of 2 x part two-storey and part single storey dwellinghouses with basement accommodation with associated vehicle parking space and access gate (following demolition garages).'
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from 12/02/2021 which is the date of planning permission 200760FUL.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:

Location plan, Flood map, Sheffield bike stand, P.1 - Existing ground floor plan, P.2 - Existing elevations, P.3 - Proposed elevations, P.4 A - Axonometric 001, P.5 - CGI, P.6 - CGI, P.7 - CGI, P.8 - CGI, P.9 - CGI, P.10 - Proposed basement, P.11 A - Proposed ground floor plan, P.12 A - Proposed first floor plan, P.13 - Proposed roof plan, P.14 A - Proposed section, P.15 A - Proposed section, P.16 A - Proposed landscape plan, P.17 - Green roof treatment, P.19 - Access details, Brick details, Turntable details, Email received on 15/09/2020 concerning waste.
And amended by drawing numbers:
Drawing number 100PL Rev A - Proposed vehicle tracking.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| This shall be carried out as per approved under permission 215234CND

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); policy 3.4 of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012); the London Plan (2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out as per the approved plans. Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season. For the avoidance of doubt, this includes the green roofs.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (i) and 1.2 (d) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), the London Plan (2021) and policy 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.

| Refuse and recycling storage areas as shown on the approved plans and as stated on the email received on 15/09/2020 shall be provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter. The refuse management arrangements as received via email on 15/09/2020 shall also be implemented and remain in place for perpetuity.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2021).

| A minimum of four (4) secured cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site as shown on hereby approved plans and in accordance with the adopted standards of the London Plan (2016). Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and increase the use of active and sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The first-floor windows on the southern elevation on each dwelling, which provide light and outlook to the stairs of both properties (shown on drawing number P.12), shall at all times be glazed with obscure glass.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4, and 7.B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); the London Plan (2021); and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement or other alteration of the new dwellinghouses shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local planning authority.

Reason: The local planning authority considers that further development could cause detriment to the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area and for this reason would wish to control any future development to comply with section 7 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and the London Plan 2021.
| Part A) This shall be as approved under application 216756CND
B) This shall be as approved under application 216756CND
C) This shall be as approved under application 221239CND

D) Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be produced, and is subject to the approval in writing of the Local Planning Authority. The verification report submitted shall be in accordance with the latest Environment Agency guidance and industry best practice.

Reason: To ensure the land contamination issues are addressed in accordance with policy1.1 (j) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), the London Plan 2021 and Ealing Local Variation to London Plan Policy 5.21 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013.
| No part of the roof of the single storey projections shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4, and 7.B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); adopted Development (or Core) Strategy (April 2012); the London Plan (2012); and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to occupation of the dwellings, the parking space as shown on the approved plans shall be constructed and operational. The number of parking spaces within the site shall also not be increased above and beyond what is shown on the approved plans without first obtaining permission from the LPA.
Reason: In the interest of public safety, in accordance with the London Plan (2021); and policy 1.1(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012).

| The rating noise level emitted from the gates hereby approved, as assessed under BS4142:2014, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA, as measured at 3.5m from the nearest sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during periods of operation.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), the London Plan (2012) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| No planting or fencing (including walls or other means of enclosure) shall be provided exceeding a height of 0.6m high within the pedestrian visibility splays (measuring 1.5m x 1.5m).
Reason: In the interest of public safety, in accordance with policies T6 of the London Plan (2021); and policy 1.1(f) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012).
| This shall be carried out as per the approved application 215530CND

Reason: To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1(e)(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); the London Plan (2021); the National Planning Policy Framework (2012); Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006); and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
